thread.section_title: High School Sports, Prep Sports in Los Angeles, San Fernando Valley: Los Angeles Daily News
thread.title: Crescenta Valley football easily beats Pasadena
thread.title_full: Crescenta Valley football easily beats Pasadena

author: Mike Branom, Correspondent
title: Crescenta Valley football easily beats Pasadena
text:
PASADENA >> Evan Nelson scored three times on 1-yard quarterback sneaks and passed for another touchdown, leading Crescenta Valley to a 41-14 Pacific League win over Pasadena on Friday night.
The Falcons (6-2, 4-1) have won four consecutive league games by a 141-point margin. Next Friday, they’ll play at first-place Burroughs.
Pasadena (4-4, 2-3) suffered its first home loss in five games.
Nelson’s first scoring plunge early in the second quarter put Crescenta Valley up 13-0. The touchdown ended a three-play, 20-yard drive gift-wrapped by the first of three takeaways by the Falcon defense.
Pasadena’s ensuing possession ended with an interception at the Bulldogs’ 37, and Nelson completed three passes for 32 yards to set up Joe Suh’s 4-yard scoring run for a 20-0 lead.
At that point, Crescenta Valley had run 22 plays for 151 yards (6.9 yard average) and 12 first downs.
